document.docAuthor: De Moraes, Gilberto J., Britto, Erika P. J., Mineiro, Jefferson L. De C. & Halliday, Bruce
document.masterDocTitle: Catalogue of the mite families Ascidae Voigts & Oudemans, Blattisociidae Garman and Melicharidae Hirschmann (Acari: Mesostigmata)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Catalogue of the mite families Ascidae Voigts & Oudemans, Blattisociidae Garman and Melicharidae Hirschmann (Acari: Mesostigmata)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Seius muricatus
.—
Berlese, 1887 b
: 6
. Misidentification, according to
Oudemans, 1938
: 2
and
Baker & Wharton, 1952
: 88
, who used the specimens to describe
Typhlodromus berlesei
and
Lasioseius aba
respectively.

Lasioseius ( Lasioseius ) muricatus
.—
Berlese, 1916 a
: 33
;
Schweizer, 1924
: 126
.

Lasioseius aba
Baker & Wharton, 1952
: 88
(Synonymy by
Evans, 1958 a
: 217
;
Westerboer, 1963
: 264
;
Lindquist, 1964 a
: 248
; Walter & Lindquist, 1989 : 2798 ;
Farrier & Hennessey, 1993
: 35
;
Christian & Karg, 2006
: 119
).

Lasioseius sylvestris
Pinchuk, 1972 a
: 70
(Synonymy by
Bregetova, 1977 a
: 177
; Walter & Lindquist, 1989 : 2798 ;
Farrier & Hennessey, 1993
: 35
;
Christian & Karg, 2006
: 119
).

subSubSection.paragraph:
TYPE
DEPOSITORY: of
L . berlesei : Istituto Sperimentale
per la Zoologia Agraria, Firenze, Italy ; of
L . sylvestris
: Institute of Zoology, Moldavian Academy of Sciences, Kishinau, Moldova .

TYPE
LOCALITY AND HABITAT : of
L . berlesei
: Veneto, Padua, Italy , in moss on rotten leaves; of
L . sylvestris : Lozovaya Forest
, Kharkiv, Ukraine , in nest of
Clethrionomys glareolus
[Animalia: Muridae ].

NOTES : (a)
Lasioseius berlesei Willmann, 1943
was a replacement name for
Seius muricatus sensu
Berlese ( 1887 b)
. It is a junior homonym and objective synonym of
Lasioseius berlesei (
Oudemans, 1938
)
; (b) Specimens reported as
Lasioseius ( Lasioseius ) berlesei (Oudemans)
by
Westerboer ( 1963 : 264 )
were re-identified as
Orthadenella lawrencei
by
Athias-Henriot ( 1973 a: 22 )
and
Christian & Karg ( 2006 : 124 )
and described as
L . frondeus
by
Karg ( 1965 : 284 )
; (c)
Karg ( 1980 : 348 )
considered
L . berlesei
to be a senior synonym of
Lasioseius confusus Evans. We
adopted the interpretation of Walter & Lindquist ( 1989 : 2800 ), considering them to be distinct species; (d) some of the specimens reported as
Lasioseius paucisetosus Westerboer
by
Lapina ( 1976 a: 72 )
were suspected to correspond to
L . berlesei
and
Lasioseius confusus Evans
by Walter & Lindquist ( 1989 : 2800 ).
